MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
OOoenomiya took my hand and walked towards the light. I didn't say anything, I didn't ask anything.
I just followed behind her as she led the way.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: OOoenomiya
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hey, we're here.

As OOoenomiya led me by the hand through the forest, we came across a hut standing alone in a clearing.
There was a small field and a pond, and a water mill was turning.

I'm surprised.
Does someone live in this place?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: OOoenomiya
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
No, this place has remained vacant for so long.
Nobody has lived here for hundreds of years.

Hundreds of years? That's impossible. The hut, the water mill, and the pond are all in fine condition.
There's every sign that someone is living here.

But, on saying that, I remembered what OOoenomiya told me about the spell.
That's right, I suppose this place too is under OOoenomiya's spell.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: OOoenomiya
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Precisely.
My spell has also kept this place in its original state.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: OOoenomiya
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
A long time ago, the Onin child living here told a lie to her mother and left to test her skills.
She journeyed to the Demon Mountain, covered in mist and filled with monsters.

However, when the Onin child climbed the Demon Mountain, she had the misfortune of encountering a group of Nishiki's sorcerers. In an attempt to befriend the humans and get some work, the Onin child tried to show off her power.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: OOoenomiya
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
That's why she approached the humans.
She didn't know what they thought of her.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: OOoenomiya
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: ...Even on my own, I don't come so often.

That's why the Onin child lied so that
her mother wouldn't worry and go looking for her.

The Onin child did not tell her mother she was going to Demon Mountain.
Her mother was so weak from her illness that she could not walk on her own.

"Mother, I'm going to the forest to gather food.
Father will be back tomorrow, so let's prepare a feast for him."

With the sword her mother had just given her at her side,
the Onin child set out for Demon Mountain.

When the Onin child was still small, her mother forbid her from climbing Demon Mountain,
but now that she was older, she thought it would be OK.

One day, the Onin child, wanting to train with her sword, decided to climb the highest of the several peaks visible from the top of the mountain, "Demon Mountain,"
which was greatly feared by the people at the foot of the mountain.

There were only three Onin on the mountain. The father worked as a bodyguard and rarely came home,
so the child lived quietly with her sick mother.
...Let me tell you a story about an Onin child who lived on a certain mountain.
...Those were the last words the Onin child ever said to her family.

After following OOoenomiya along the trail for a while, I saw a light through a gap in the overgrown trees. We were walking a good distance, but it didn't feel like we were climbing a mountain. This kind of path is the easiest to get lost on. It would be terrible if I got separated from OOoenomiya.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: OOoenomiya
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
In the past, the Onin had a strong admiration for humans. In order to gain the trust of humans and to protect them, the Onin built up their strength.
That's what her mother had taught her.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: OOoenomiya
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Right. I've taken pupils here before,
but most of the time I come alone.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: OOoenomiya
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: This...is the village where the Onin child lived.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: OOoenomiya
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
It's not because I'm worried about you. From here on out, you can't proceed unless you touch my body.
That's the kind of spell that's been cast.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: OOoenomiya
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
However, as a side effect, she was cursed with immortality and bound to the earth. The Onin child could not leave Demon Mountain, nor could she cook for her father,
nor could she be there to see her mother pass away.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: OOoenomiya
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
It is a book from the time when Mount Ooe was still called Demon Mountain. The name of the Onin child was OOoenomiya.
Ironically, being mistaken for a demon helped her to achieve her tribe's dearest wish.
...To become close to the humans.
To live as an Onin dedicated to protecting the entire world.

In a quiet, empty hometown,
OOoenomiya makes a vow to her mother.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: OOoenomiya
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
The Onin Ooenomyia has dedicated her entire life to protecting humans.
I swear by the entire family on Mount Ooe and by my mother's sword.

The book of OOoenomiya's heroic tale, "The Onin Child," contains only one story in which the mother of the
Onin child plays an active role.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: OOoenomiya
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
There are several words used to describe me, such as "mountain guardian" and "mountain god",
but as an Onin child, there is no role I am more proud of than serving as a "guardian."

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: OOoenomiya
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Soon after I was bound to Mount Ooe, the town at the foot of the mountain was attacked by the phantom mist. At that time, an Onin came down from the mountain and single-handedly protected the town.
My mother fulfilled her dream before she passed away. She used her last bit of strength.

The nobleman, whose life was saved by OOoenomiya's mother, had searched for more than 5 years
for a way to lift the curse on OOoenomiya in order to return the favor.

I see. So that's how it is. A place that only those with OOoenomiya's permission can enter.
It wouldn't be possible for large groups of people, either.

The earth-binding curse that trapped OOoenomiya on Mount Ooe was lifted by the daughter of a certain nobleman.
That person was the first person OOoenomiya served.

No, there's surely really no need for that. With this many trees and bushes,
it would be much harder to walk hand in hand.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: OOoenomiya
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
The day will come when the Onin will join hands with many humans and laugh together.
That's what my mother used to say every day...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: OOoenomiya
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: From here on out, hold onto my hand as we go.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: OOoenomiya
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
The rest is as written in the book you have. The Onin child was put under a spell to seal away demons.
But the spell only works on demons, and so didn't work on the Onin child.
...To bring peace to the mountain, and to make it a place bustling with humans.
